intro: Schivereckia iberidea, commonly known as the Iberian schivereckia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Schivereckia iberidea is known for its limited distribution and is considered a species of conservation concern due to habitat loss and fragmentation. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and botanical research.
